title-part.text: VEHICLE TYRES
TYRE INFLATION
TYRE CHANGING OR REPAIRING
REPAIRING, OR CONNECTING VALVES TO, INFLATABLE ELASTIC BODIES IN GENERAL
DEVICES OR ARRANGEMENTS RELATED TO TYRES

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass, the term "tyre" is to be understood as a separate ground-engaging, continuous element outside the periphery of the wheel rim and includes the tyre casing, cover, or jacket and any insert, e.g. inner tube. In the groups relating to repair or connection of valves, the term "tyre" is to be understood to include also inflatable elastic bodies other than tyres or inner tubes
Attention is drawn to the note following the title of class B 60.

subnote.note-paragraph:
The following IPC groups are not used in the CPC scheme. Subject matter covered by these groups is classified in the following CPC groups:
B60C11/113 covered by B60C11/0311
B60C11/117 covered by B60C11/032

title-part.text: Tyres characterised by the chemical composition or the physical arrangement or mixture of the composition

note.note-paragraph: Tyres characterised by compositions only, i.e. having no significant tyre structure, are classified only with the compositions, e.g. C08K , C08L

Compositions of the tread
Compositions of the sidewalls
Compositions of the carcass layers

title-part.text: Carcasses

CPC-specific-text.text: Carcasses comprising an interrupted ply, i.e. where the carcass ply does not continuously extend from bead to bead but is interrupted, e.g. at the belt area, into two or more portions of the same ply
built up from narrow strips, individual cords or filaments, e.g. using filament winding
characterised by special physical properties of the carcass ply
Carcass ply curvature

title-part.text: the reinforcing cords of each carcass ply arranged in a substantially parallel relationship

Grooves
Circumferential grooves
provided at the equatorial plane
with zigzag shape
Narrow grooves, i.e. having a width of less than 4 mm
Shallow grooves, i.e. having a depth of less than 50% of other grooves
characterised by width
characterised by depth
Lateral grooves, i.e. having an angle of 45 to 90 degees to the equatorial plane
Narrow grooves, i.e. having a width of less than 3 mm
Shallow grooves, i.e. having a depth of less than 50% of other grooves
characterised by width
characterised by depth
with varying depth of the groove
with particular inclination angles

characterised by width
characterised by depth
Blind or isolated grooves
at the centre of the tread
Continuous ribs
provided at the equatorial plane
provided at the shoulder portion

for linking shoulder blocks

characterised by the use of narrow slits or incisions, e.g. sipes
